verses.verse: And when the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> heard<WH8085> of the fame<WH8088> of Solomon<WH8010> concerning the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>, she came<WH935> to prove<WH5254> him with hard questions<WH2420>.

And she came<WH935> to Jerusalem<WH3389> with a very<WH3966> great<WH3515> train<WH2428>, with camels<WH1581> that bare<WH5375> spices<WH1314>, and very<WH3966> much<WH7227> gold<WH2091>, and precious<WH3368> stones<WH68>; and when she was come<WH935> to Solomon<WH8010>, she communed<WH1696> with him of all that was in her heart<WH3824>.
And Solomon<WH8010> told<WH5046> her all her questions<WH1697>: there was not anything<WH1697> hid<WH5956> from the king<WH4428> which he told her not<WH5046>.
And when the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> had seen<WH7200> all the wisdom<WH2451> of Solomon<WH8010>, and the house<WH1004> that he had built<WH1129>,

and the food<WH3978> of his table<WH7979>, and the sitting<WH4186> of his servants<WH5650>, and the attendance<WH4612> of his ministers<WH8334>, and their apparel<WH4403>, and his cupbearers<WH8248>, and his ascent<WH5930> by which he went up<WH5927> unto the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>; there was no more spirit in her<WH7307>.
And she said<WH559> to the king<WH4428>, It was a true<WH571> report<WH1697> that I heard<WH8085> in mine own land<WH776> of thine acts<WH1697>, and of thy wisdom<WH2451>.

Howbeit I believed<WH539> not the words<WH1697>, until I came<WH935>, and mine eyes<WH5869> had seen<WH7200> it<WH2677>: and, behold, the half was not told<WH5046> me<WH2451>; thy wisdom and prosperity<WH2896> exceed<WH3254> the fame<WH8052> which I heard<WH8085>.
Happy <WH835> are thy men<WH582>, happy<WH835> are these thy servants<WH5650>, that stand<WH5975> continually<WH8548> before<WH6440> thee<WH8085>, and that hear thy wisdom<WH2451>.

Blessed <WH1288> be Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, who delighted<WH2654> in thee<WH5414>, to set thee on the throne<WH3678> of Israel<WH3478>: because Jehovah<WH3068> loved<WH160> Israel<WH3478> for ever<WH5769>, therefore made<WH7760> he thee king<WH4428>, to do<WH6213> justice<WH4941> and righteousness<WH6666>.

And she gave<WH5414> the king<WH4428> a hundred<WH3967> and twenty<WH6242> talents<WH3603> of gold<WH2091>, and of spices<WH1314> very<WH3966> great store<WH7235>, and precious<WH3368> stones<WH68>: there came<WH935> no more such<WH1931> abundance<WH7230> of spices<WH1314> as these which the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> gave<WH5414> to king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010>.

And the navy<WH590> also of Hiram<WH2438>, that brought<WH5375> gold<WH2091> from Ophir<WH211>, brought in<WH935> from Ophir<WH211> great<WH3966> plenty<WH7235> of almug<WH484> - trees<WH6086> and precious<WH3368> stones<WH68>.

And the king<WH4428> made<WH6213> of the almug<WH484> - trees<WH6086> pillars<WH4552> for the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and for the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, harps<WH3658> also and psalteries<WH5035> for the singers<WH7891>: there came<WH935> no such almug<WH484> - trees<WH6086>, nor were seen<WH7200>, unto this day<WH3117>.

And king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> gave<WH5414> to the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> all her desire<WH2656>, whatsoever she asked<WH7592>, besides that which Solomon<WH8010> gave<WH5414> her of his royal<WH4428> bounty<WH3027>. So she turned<WH6437>, and went<WH3212> to her own land<WH776>, she and her servants<WH5650>.

Now the weight<WH4948> of gold<WH2091> that came<WH935> to Solomon<WH8010> in one<WH259> year<WH8141> was six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> threescore<WH8346> and six<WH8337> talents<WH3603> of gold<WH2091>,

besides that which the traders<WH582> brought<WH4536>, and the traffic of the merchants<WH7402>, and of all the kings<WH4428> of the mingled<WH6153> people<WH6346>, and of the governors of the country<WH776>.

And king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> made<WH6213> two hundred<WH3967> bucklers<WH6793> of beaten<WH7820> gold<WH2091>; six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> shekels of gold<WH2091> went<WH5927> to one<WH259> buckler<WH6793>.

And he made three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> shields<WH4043> of beaten<WH7820> gold<WH2091>; three<WH7969> pounds<WH4488> of gold<WH2091> went<WH5927> to one<WH259> shield<WH4043>: and the king<WH4428> put<WH5414> them in the house<WH1004> of the forest<WH3293> of Lebanon<WH3844>.
Moreover the king<WH4428> made<WH6213> a great<WH1419> throne<WH3678> of ivory<WH8127>, and overlaid<WH6823> it with the finest<WH6338> gold<WH2091>.

There were six<WH8337> steps<WH4609> to the throne<WH3678>, and the top<WH7218> of the throne<WH3678> was round<WH5696> behind<WH310>; and there were stays<WH3027> on either side by the place<WH4725> of the seat<WH7675>, and two<WH8147> lions<WH738> standing<WH5975> beside<WH681> the stays<WH3027>.
And twelve<WH8147> lions<WH738> stood<WH5975> there on the one side and on the other upon the six<WH8337> steps<WH4609>: there was not the like<WH3651> made<WH6213> in any kingdom<WH4467>.

And all king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010>'s drinking<WH4945> vessels<WH3627> were of gold<WH2091>, and all the vessels<WH3627> of the house<WH1004> of the forest<WH3293> of Lebanon<WH3844> were of pure<WH5462> gold<WH2091>: none were of silver<WH3701>; it was nothing<WH3972> accounted<WH2803> of in the days<WH3117> of Solomon<WH8010>.

For the king<WH4428> had at sea<WH3220> a navy<WH590> of Tarshish<WH8659> with the navy<WH590> of Hiram<WH2438>: once<WH259> every three<WH7969> years<WH8141> came<WH935> the navy<WH590> of Tarshish<WH8659>, bringing<WH5375> gold<WH2091>, and silver<WH3701>, ivory<WH8143>, and apes<WH6971>, and peacocks<WH8500>.
So king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> exceeded<WH1431> all the kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> in riches<WH6239> and in wisdom<WH2451>.
And all the earth<WH776> sought<WH1245> the presence of Solomon<WH8010>, to<WH6440> hear<WH8085> his wisdom<WH2451>, which God<WH430> had put<WH5414> in his heart<WH3820>.

And they brought<WH935> every man<WH376> his tribute<WH4503>, vessels<WH3627> of silver<WH3701>, and vessels<WH3627> of gold<WH2091>, and raiment<WH8008>, and armor<WH5402>, and spices<WH1314>, horses<WH5483>, and mules<WH6505>, a rate<WH1697> year<WH8141> by year<WH8141>.

And Solomon<WH8010> gathered together<WH622> chariots<WH7393> and horsemen<WH6571>: and he had a thousand<WH505> and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393>, and twelve<WH8147> thousand<WH505> horsemen<WH6571>, that he bestowed<WH5148> in the chariot<WH7393> cities<WH5892>, and with the king<WH4428> at Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And the king<WH4428> made<WH5414> silver<WH3701> to be in Jerusalem<WH3389> as stones<WH68>, and cedars<WH730> made<WH5414> he to be as the sycomore-trees<WH8256> that are in the lowland<WH8219>, for abundance<WH7230>.

And the horses<WH5483> which Solomon<WH8010> had were brought<WH4161> out of Egypt<WH4714>; and the king<WH4428>'s merchants<WH5503> received<WH3947> them in droves<WH4723>, each drove<WH4723> at a price<WH4242>.

And a chariot<WH4818> came up<WH5927> and went out<WH3318> of Egypt<WH4714> for six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> shekels of silver<WH3701>, and a horse<WH5483> for a hundred<WH3967> and fifty<WH2572>; and so for all the kings<WH4428> of the Hittites<WH2850>, and for the kings<WH4428> of Syria<WH758>, did they bring them out<WH3318> by their means<WH3027>.
